answers.answer: Hi,How are you? It is good that your enzymes were okay and initial ct scan was done. Development of NASH may be the result of  liver insults where , macrovesicular steatosis, inflammatory response and progression of liver damage occurs. There is no treatment for NASH but you may be able to limit damage to the liver by managing conditions that increase the risk for NASH or make it worse. Also, outlook of NASH depends on risk factors such as  obesity, insulin resistance, type 2 diabetes. It is best that you check with your doctor  regularly for proper evaluation and monitoring. Take care and do keep us posted.

question: i had liver inflammation 1.5 years ago but after following a diet and losing weight  my enzymes were okay.then,  4 months later i did a ct scan also and the result  was as follows:"Normal volume of the liver with homogeneous contrast capture of the parenchyma; subtotal visualization of liver segment 8 in this study which some reserve for the assessment."whay does the above mean? does it mena that at that time nash was ok?2 months ago, i started to have elevated  ast and alt again. i
title: is nash reversible?
